video.title: 2d Game Dev Unity Tutorial - Hyper Casual Game
video.description:
In this full Unity tutorial, you will learn to create a simple 2d Hyper Casual game using Unity and C#. You will learn tips and tricks on how to work with Unity to achieve the best results in the simplest way possible.

🔗Game Assets: https://github.com/AwesomeTuts/cube-fall-hyper-casual-game

Tutorial created by Awesome Tuts. Check out Awesome Tuts Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5c-DuzPdH9iaWYdI0v0uzw

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

replies.author: Yanuka Deneth
replies.text:
This is a method of incrementing a value which is equally to all devices with different fps.

The Update function is called every frame right? So, its called faster on devices which has high fps and slower on devices which have slow fps.

So if we used "current_Platform_Spawn_Timer++;" then the incrementing time is different across devices since the function (Update) is called at different times on different devices as explained above.

Using delta time, the increment is close to the same across all devices. Thats how delta time works.
"platform_Spawn_Timer" is actually a constant value which the "current_Platform_Spawn_Timer++;" compares too.

I think this is what happens and if Im wrong, do correct me :)
